detailed_results.input: The Romans, in the countries which they annexed, observed closely these measures; they sent colonies and maintained friendly relations with the minor powers, without increasing their strength; they kept down the greater, and did not allow any strong foreign powers to gain authority.
detailed_results.reasoning: Coalition differs (<<Romans>> vs <<Rome>>), and the prediction adds/changes key propositions: it introduces extra constraints (!stronger, !strong_foreign_power_allowed) and replaces/renames others (keep_down_the_greater vs big_controlled) without clear aliasing. Thus it does not match the exact meaning of the gold formula.

detailed_results.input: The network system can guarantee that critical packet loss will never occur.
detailed_results.reasoning: Exact match (normalized).

detailed_results.input: The robot number 3 has a strategy to force that eventually position 2 holds and never position 4 afterwards.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold requires that after reaching pos2, from the next step onward pos4 is never true (X G !pos4). The prediction omits the X, enforcing G !pos4 immediately (including at the pos2 state), which is a stronger and different property.

detailed_results.input: The system and the controller together can guarantee that sooner or later consumption will be reduced.
detailed_results.reasoning: Coalition matches the described agents (system + controller) and the temporal operator F captures 'sooner or later'. Predicate matches the stated outcome.

detailed_results.input: Given three robots, none of them has a strategy to ensure that whenever position 2 holds, position 1 will hold in the next step.
detailed_results.gold: !<<Robot1>> G (pos2 -> X pos1) && !<<Robot2>> G (pos2 -> X pos1) && !<<Robot3>> G (pos2 -> X pos1)
detailed_results.reasoning: The input/gold says each individual robot lacks a strategy to enforce globally that whenever pos2 holds then pos1 holds in the next step: !<<Ri>> G(pos2 -> X pos1) for i=1..3, conjoined. The prediction instead gives a positive ability for the grand coalition <<Robot1,Robot2,Robot3>> and only for the next step X, and it also drops the inner X (uses pos2 -> pos1). This changes coalition, polarity, and temporal structure.

detailed_results.input: The collaborative robot can guarantee that if a stop is requested, then at the next step it will stop moving.
detailed_results.reasoning: Exact match (normalized).

detailed_results.input: The system and the administrator together can guarantee that sooner or later security will be restored.
detailed_results.reasoning: Coalition mismatch: gold specifies <<SecuritySystem,Admin>> while prediction uses <<System,Admin>>. Unless explicitly an alias, this changes which agents have the ability, so the ATL meaning is not guaranteed to be the same.

detailed_results.input: The climate control system can guarantee that sooner or later the temperature will return to a stable state.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (climate control system) and same temporal operator F expressing eventuality; predicate is a clear alias (temperature_stable vs stable_temperature).

detailed_results.input: The Parties agree that an armed attack against one or more of them in Europe or North America shall be considered an attack against them all and consequently they agree that, if such an armed attack occurs, each of them, in exercise of the right of individual or collective self-defence recognised by Article 51 of the Charter of the United Nations, will assist the Party or Parties so attacked by taking forthwith, individually and in concert with the other Parties, such action as it deems necessary, including the use of armed force, to restore and maintain the security of the North Atlantic area.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold states the coalition <<Parties>> can ensure security_restored holds after an attack via an until: (attack U security_restored). Prediction changes the coalition (only Country1, Country2), changes the temporal structure from U to a global implication with eventual assistance (G(attack -> F assist_attacked)), and changes the target condition from security_restored to assist_attacked. These are not semantically equivalent.

detailed_results.input: The robot number 1 has a strategy to guarantee that it will keep position 1 until move is true and while not attack.
detailed_results.reasoning: The prediction changes the grouping: it parses as ((pos1 U move) && !attack) rather than pos1 U (move && !attack). This would require !attack to hold immediately (and always along the path due to conjunction outside U), not just at the until-termination condition, so the meaning differs.

detailed_results.input: The satellite can guarantee that sooner or later it will establish a link with the ground station.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (Satellite) and same temporal operator F expressing eventuality; the predicate link_with_ground is a clear paraphrase of establishing a link with the ground station (link_established).

detailed_results.input: The machine can guarantee that if the payment does not occur, the ticket will never be printed.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (Machine) and same temporal structure: globally, if payment does not occur then globally the ticket is not printed. Predicate 'payment_done' is a clear alias of 'paid'.

detailed_results.input: The robotic arm can guarantee that if the object is grasped, then at the next step it will start transport.
detailed_results.reasoning: Exact match (normalized).

detailed_results.input: The autonomous vehicle can guarantee that it will never exceed the speed limit.
detailed_results.reasoning: Exact match (normalized).

detailed_results.input: The control system can guarantee that it will keep regulating until the error becomes zero.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (ControlSystem) and same temporal structure (U). The predicate "error == 0" is a clear syntactic variant/alias of "error_zero" from the sentence.

detailed_results.input: The rover can guarantee that when it is ready to sample, at the next step it will start sampling.
detailed_results.reasoning: Predicate mismatch: gold requires that the next step satisfies sampling_started (the start event), while prediction requires sampling (being in sampling state). Starting sampling is not equivalent to sampling in general, so the meaning changes.

detailed_results.input: The mobile robot can guarantee that sooner or later it will reach the charging station.
detailed_results.reasoning: Exact match (normalized).

detailed_results.input: The system and the operators together can guarantee that sooner or later the area will be secured.
detailed_results.reasoning: The coalition is different: gold requires the joint ability of {EmergencySystem, Operators}, while the prediction uses {System, Operator}. Changing agent names/sets changes who has the strategic ability, so the ATL meaning is not preserved.

detailed_results.input: Robots number 1 and number 2 together have a strategy to ensure in the next step not position 5 and not position 4.
detailed_results.reasoning: The prediction is parsed as (<<Robot1, Robot2>> X !pos5) && !pos4, which only enforces !pos5 at the next step and requires !pos4 immediately (outside the X and outside the coalition modality). The gold requires both !pos5 and !pos4 to hold at the next step under the coalition’s strategy: <<Robot1, Robot2>> X (!pos5 && !pos4).

detailed_results.input: The satellite can guarantee that it will keep adjusting attitude until the antenna is aligned.
detailed_results.reasoning: Exact match (normalized).

detailed_results.reasoning: Exact match (normalized).

detailed_results.input: The robot number 3 has a strategy to ensure that eventually position 2 holds and then in the next step position 1 holds.
detailed_results.reasoning: Exact match (normalized).

detailed_results.input: The coalition of robots 2 and 3 has a strategy to ensure that eventually either attack or defend holds and not retreat.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold requires eventually ((attack OR defend) AND not retreat). Prediction parses as attack OR (defend AND not retreat) due to operator precedence, allowing attack even when retreat holds, which changes the meaning.

detailed_results.input: The Lord will fulfill his purpose for me.
detailed_results.reasoning: Both formulas state that the Lord has a strategy to eventually achieve the fulfillment condition (F). The predicate name differs (fulfilled vs fulfillment) but is a clear alias for the same concept in the sentence.

detailed_results.input: Robots number 2 and number 3 have a strategy to guarantee that they will eventually reach position 1 and eventually reach position 2.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold requires both eventualities independently: F pos1 and F pos2 (order irrelevant). Prediction instead requires eventually reaching a state where pos1 holds and from that point eventually pos2 holds, i.e., pos2 must occur after a pos1-state. This is a stronger, different property.

detailed_results.input: The robotic arm can guarantee that if it detects a collision, then at the next step it will stop.
detailed_results.reasoning: Predicate mismatch: gold conditions on collision_detected (the arm detects a collision), while prediction uses collision (a collision occurs). Detection vs occurrence are not guaranteed to be equivalent, so the meaning changes.

detailed_results.input: The recommender system can guarantee that it will keep learning until accuracy improves.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold requires the coalition to ensure (learning U accuracy_improved) from the current state. The prediction adds an outer G, requiring that at all times along the path, (learning U accuracy_improved) holds again, which is strictly stronger and changes the temporal meaning.

detailed_results.input: The robotic arm can guarantee that it will keep moving toward the target until it reaches it.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (Arm) and same until structure: continuing to move toward the target until the target is reached. Predicate names are clear paraphrases (moving_to_target≈moving_toward_target, at_target≈reached).

detailed_results.input: The drone can guarantee that if it loses GPS signal, then at the next step it will switch to inertial navigation.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (Drone) and same temporal structure G( -> X ). The predicate inertial_nav is a clear alias of inertial_nav_on (switching to inertial navigation), so meaning is preserved.

detailed_results.input: The machine can guarantee that at the next step the ticket will be validated.
detailed_results.reasoning: Exact match (normalized).

detailed_results.input: The machine can guarantee that if the ticket is printed, then sooner or later it will be validated.
detailed_results.reasoning: Exact match (normalized).

detailed_results.input: The machine can guarantee that the gate will never open without payment.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold states a conditional safety property: always, if payment is not made then the gate is not open (<<Machine>>G(!paid -> !gate_open)). The prediction uses a single atomic proposition gate_open_without_payment, which is not guaranteed to be equivalent to (!paid && gate_open) or to the implication form; it could encode something different. Thus the meaning is not preserved.

detailed_results.input: The robot number 1 has a strategy to ensure that always eventually position 2 or always eventually position 3.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold is a disjunction of two separate liveness guarantees: either GF pos2 holds or GF pos3 holds. Prediction is G(F pos2 || F pos3), which only requires that at every time, eventually pos2 or pos3 occurs (possibly alternating), and does not imply GF pos2 nor GF pos3. Thus the temporal/connective structure changes the meaning.

detailed_results.input: The drone can guarantee that if the target is detected, then at the next step it will take a photo.
detailed_results.reasoning: Exact match (normalized).

detailed_results.input: The swarm can guarantee that if a drone fails, then at the next step it will reconfigure the formation.
detailed_results.reasoning: Same coalition (Swarm) and same temporal/conditional structure G(drone_failed -> X ...). The predicate 'new_formation' is a clear alias of 'formation_reconfigured' from the sentence.

detailed_results.input: The system and the user together can guarantee that sooner or later a good recommendation will be found.
detailed_results.reasoning: Coalition mismatch: gold specifies <<Recommender,User>> while prediction uses <<System,User>>. Changing the agent set changes who has the ability to ensure eventual good_recommendation.

detailed_results.input: The collaborative robot can guarantee that it will never cause a collision with a human.
detailed_results.reasoning: Gold specifies never causing a collision with a human (!human_collision). Prediction uses !collision, which forbids all collisions (including non-human ones) and is not semantically equivalent unless collision is explicitly defined as human collision.

detailed_results.input: Therefore, take me and bind me to the crosspiece half way up the mast; bind me as I stand upright, with a bond so fast that I cannot possibly break away, and lash the rope’s ends to the mast itself. If I beg and pray you to set me free, then bind me more tightly still.
detailed_results.prediction: <<Me>>(G binded_to_mast && G upright && fast_bond && G lashed_to_mast && (begs && prays -> G binded_more_tightly))
detailed_results.reasoning: The prediction changes both structure and meaning. Gold is a single global implication: always, if (binded AND praying) then bind_tightly, under coalition <<Odysseus>>. Prediction uses a different agent (<<Me>>), splits conditions into separate conjuncts (some not under G), adds extra requirements (upright, fast_bond, lashed_to_mast), and changes the consequence to 'G binded_more_tightly' triggered by (begs AND prays) rather than bind_tightly triggered by (binded AND praying). These are not semantically equivalent.
